name: Hans-Georg Fill
content: Prof. Dr. Hans-Georg Fill | Digitalization and Information Systems Group | University of Fribourg Prof. Dr. Hans-Georg Fill Hans-Georg Fill is a full professor for business informatics at the University of Fribourg and head of the Digitalization and Information Systems Group. Since 08/2025 he is co-president of the Department of Informatics (DIUF). He coordinates the activities of the University of Fribourg in the Smart Living Lab, a joint project of EPFL, HEIA-FR, and UniFR. Prior to his engagement at the University of Fribourg he held positions at the University of Bamberg, Germany (2017-2018) and the University of Vienna, Austria (2015-2016). In addition, he was a visiting scholar at Stanford University, USA (2008, 2010-2011), the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Mines at Saint-Etienne, France (2015) and the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT), Germany (2012). He holds a PhD and a habilitation in business informatics from the University of Vienna. Research interestsThe main research field of Hans-Georg Fill is conceptual modeling for enterprise information systems. In particular he works in the area of meta modeling, i.e. the conceptualisation and technical realization of modeling methods. His current research interests are semantic information systems, blockchains and smart contracts, the application of virtual and augmented reality in enterprise modeling as well as the deviceless interaction with enterprise information systems. ActivitiesHans-Georg Fill is supporting editor in chief of the Enterprise Modelling and Information Systems Architectures - International Journal of Conceptual Modelling (EMISAJ) and was co-department editor of the Department Enterprise Modeling and Enterprise Engineering of the Business and Information Systems Engineering (BISE) journal from 2021-2025 and a member of the editorial boards of the International Journal of Information System Modeling and Design (IJISMD) and Annals of Computer Science and Information Systems (ACSIS). Further, he is a member of several program committees of conferences in the domain of business informatics, enterprise modeling and information systems such as the European Conference on Information Systems (ECIS), the International Conference on Business Informatics (WI), the International Conference on Conceptual Modeling (ER), the International Conference on Advanced Information Systems Engineering (CAiSE),  or the International Conference on Research Challenges in Information Science (RCIS). He is co-president and co-founder of the Special Interest Group Business Informatics (SIG Business Informatics) of the Swiss Informatics Society and member and speaker of the special interest group on modeling enterprise information systems (SIG MoBIS) of the German Informatics Society (GI). He is a member of the institute council of the international institute of management in technology (iimt), as part of the University of Fribourg. From 2020-2022 he was a member of the Technical Committee 07 - Business Informatics/Information Systems of ASIIN e.V. (Accreditation Agency for Study Programmes in Engineering, Informatics, Natural Sciences and Mathematics).
